title: Add dynamic ERC20 token discovery via Alchemy/Moralis API
description:
attached_molecule: ev-wisp-1ll
attached_at: 2026-02-17T19:49:54Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Route through architecture hierarchy: use ddd-system-architect to design the token discovery approach, then ddd-unit-architect for test specs, then ddd-software-engineer to implement. Add a dynamic ERC20 token discovery method that uses a multi-chain token enumeration API (Alchemy getTokenBalances or similar free/public alternative). Must return ALL ERC20 tokens held by an address across Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base. Return error details for failed tokens instead of silently skipping. Add tests. Build must pass. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

ARCHITECTURAL ANALYSIS: EvmIntegration only checks hardcoded 'popular tokens' (USDC, USDT, DAI) per chain — no dynamic token discovery. CWA bypasses EvmIntegration entirely and uses ethplorer (Ethereum-only, free key rate limited). FIX NEEDED: Add a token discovery method to EvmChainAdapter that uses Alchemy getTokenBalances() or similar multi-chain token enumeration API. This should return ALL ERC20 tokens held by an address, not just hardcoded ones. Must work across all supported chains (Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base). Should also add error details (which tokens failed) rather than silently skipping. Route through system architect → unit architect → engineer.

description:

attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Phase 4 of RPC fallback chain (per en-25w5). Wire evm-integration to use the RPC infrastructure from Phase 3 (ev-zwqy, now on main). Add createEvmIntegration(config: RpcProviderConfig) factory function. Create per-chain ethers.JsonRpcProvider instances lazily. Route ALL RPC calls in BalanceService, TransactionService, TrackingService, DeFiService through per-chain RpcFallbackChain. Remove any hardcoded RPC URLs. Integration tests: primary failure → secondary success, all-fail → cache, circuit breaker opening. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally.
dispatched_by: mayor

RPC fallback chain Phase 4 (per en-25w5 directive). Depends on Phase 3 (RPC infrastructure).

Wire evm-integration to use the fallback chain:
- Add createEvmIntegration(config: RpcProviderConfig) factory function
- Create per-chain ethers.JsonRpcProvider instances lazily on first call
- Route ALL RPC calls through per-chain RpcFallbackChain
- Remove any hardcoded RPC URLs
- BalanceService, TransactionService, TrackingService, DeFiService all use fallback chain
- Integration tests: primary failure → secondary success, all-fail → cache, circuit breaker opening
Follow TDD.

title: WebSocket subscription service — connection manager, subscriptions, polling fallback
description:
attached_molecule: ev-wisp-rxvw
attached_at: 2026-02-18T07:24:02Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. WebSocket subscription service per en-p0ha architecture directive (steps 1-5). WS connection manager with pool, lazy establishment, reconnection (exponential backoff 1s-30s, 10 retries), heartbeat (30s ping), subscription registry. newHeads subscription + block-driven balance refresh. logs subscription for ERC-20 Transfer events. Polling fallback with PollManager. Extend to all EVM chains. Export SubscriptionService interface. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement WebSocket subscription infrastructure per en-p0ha architecture directive. This covers steps 1-5:

1. WebSocket connection manager with connection pool (one WS per chain per provider tier), lazy establishment, reconnection with exponential backoff (1s base, 30s max, 10 retries), heartbeat (30s ping, 5s pong timeout), and subscription registry.

2. newHeads subscription + block-driven balance refresh. Subscribe to eth_subscribe('newHeads') once per chain, on each new block batch-fetch balances for all tracked addresses via eth_getBalance.

3. logs subscription for ERC-20 Transfer events filtered to tracked addresses (from OR to). Use keccak256('Transfer(address,address,uint256)') topic.

4. Polling fallback with PollManager. When WS fails after max retries, fall back to 30s HTTP polling. Continuously attempt WS recovery every 60s while polling. Emit same events as WS path (transport-agnostic).

5. Extend to all EVM chains (Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, BNB, Avalanche, Fantom). WS endpoints per provider documented in architecture doc Section 6.

Export SubscriptionService interface: subscribeBalances, subscribeTokenTransfers, subscribeNewBlocks, subscribePendingTransactions, subscribeContractEvents, unsubscribe, getSubscriptionStatus. Return SubscriptionHandle with onData/onError/onStatusChange callbacks.

Domain events to emit: WEBSOCKET_CONNECTED, WEBSOCKET_DISCONNECTED, WEBSOCKET_RECONNECTING, WEBSOCKET_FAILED, SUBSCRIPTION_CREATED, SUBSCRIPTION_REMOVED, TRANSPORT_FALLBACK_TO_POLLING, TRANSPORT_RESTORED_TO_WS, LIVE_BALANCE_UPDATED, LIVE_TRANSFER_DETECTED, LIVE_BLOCK_RECEIVED.

Follow TDD. Reference: enterprise-arch mayor/en-p0ha-websocket-first-architecture.md

title: Phase 3: RPC infrastructure runtime — rotateWithinTier, circuit breaker tuning, fallback chain
description:
attached_molecule: ev-wisp-dlap
attached_at: 2026-02-23T15:52:35Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Import RPC types from @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure@^1.0.1 (on npm). NOT from data-models. Follow TDD.
dispatched_by: mayor

Phase 3 of en-tfkn. Add runtime classes to @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure OR EvmIntegration (depending on where CircuitBreaker etc. currently live).

IMPORTANT: Import RPC types from @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure (NOT data-models).

MODIFY RpcFallbackChain:
- Add rotateWithinTier option: weighted round-robin within same RpcProviderRole
- Add query jitter for background requests (0-500ms via PrivacyConfig.queryJitterMs)

MODIFY Circuit Breaker thresholds for 'decentralized' provider type:
- Raise failureThreshold to 8 (from 5), failureWindowMs to 120000 (from 60000)

ADD POKT F-Chains and Lava Network URL templates to provider URL builder.

DEPENDS ON Phase 1A and Phase 2.

Reference: en-tfkn sections 3, 7, 9.
notes: Merged to main via PR #13. All 1079 tests pass.

title: Phase 3: RPC infrastructure — rotateWithinTier, decentralized circuit breaker tuning
description:
Phase 3 of en-tfkn (Decentralized RPC Provider Strategy). Update EvmIntegration RPC infrastructure.

MODIFY RpcFallbackChain:
- Add rotateWithinTier option: when enabled, endpoints within the same RpcProviderRole selected via weighted round-robin instead of strict priority
- Add query jitter for background requests (0-500ms configurable via PrivacyConfig.queryJitterMs)

MODIFY Circuit Breaker thresholds for 'decentralized' provider type:
- Raise failureThreshold to 8 (from 5)
- Raise failureWindowMs to 120000 (from 60000)
- Rationale: decentralized providers handle individual node failures at protocol level

ADD POKT F-Chains and Lava Network URL templates to provider URL builder.

DEPENDS ON Phase 1 (da- types) and Phase 2 (cy- config).

Reference: EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-tfkn-decentralized-rpc-provider-strategy.md sections 3, 7, 9. Follow TDD.
close_reason: Restructured per en-1mg1 — imports change to rpc-infrastructure

Enterprise E2E strategy (enterprise-arch/e2e-testing-strategy.md) requires EvmIntegration to have working E2E tests. Current test:e2e script fails.

Action items:
1. Fix the failing ChainRegistry.e2e.test.ts
2. Align E2E scenarios with enterprise policy: chain registry load (P0), testnet RPC connectivity (P0), native balance fetch (P0), ERC-20 balance fetch (P1), multi-chain sequential fetch (P1), RPC failover (P1), cache behavior (P2)

6. All tests must pass: npm run build && npm test && npm run test:e2e

title: Add account-attributed query results
description:
attached_molecule: ev-wisp-3ycq
attached_at: 2026-02-19T19:39:00Z
attached_args: NEVER use EnterPlanMode — it WILL freeze your session. Implement directly with TDD. This is Phase 3 (P0) of multi-wallet multi-account architecture (en-fr0z). Update @cygnus-wealth/data-models to latest version first. Reference EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md section 4. Unit tests only, no E2E. START CODING IMMEDIATELY.
dispatched_by: mayor

Phase 3 of en-fr0z (multi-wallet multi-account architecture). Depends on Phase 1 (da-x33l, now merged in data-models).

IMPLEMENT:
1. Switch all service methods from string[] addresses to AddressRequest[] — AddressRequest has accountId, address, chainScope fields.
2. Account-attributed result types — all query results (balances, transactions, tokens, NFTs, DeFi positions) carry accountId for attribution. Use AccountBalanceList, AccountBalance, AccountError pattern from the spec.
3. Address deduplication in batch queries — when AddressRequest[] contains duplicate addresses (same address, different accountIds): group by unique (address, chainId), execute one RPC query per unique pair, fan out results to all associated accountIds.
4. Subscription event attribution — SubscriptionEvent gets new accountIds: AccountId[] field (plural, since same address may belong to multiple connections). Subscription fires once per on-chain event, portfolio layer resolves account attribution.
5. Update BlockchainIntegrationContract — getBalances, getTransactions, getTokens, getNFTs, getDeFiPositions all accept AddressRequest[] and return account-attributed results. getBatchBalances for batch optimization. subscribeToUpdates accepts AddressRequest[].

Update @cygnus-wealth/data-models dependency to latest version with the new identity types. See EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md section 4 for full spec. Follow TDD.
notes: Merged to main via PR #12. All 1059 tests pass.

title: Phase 3: RPC infrastructure — FallbackChain, CircuitBreaker, RateLimiter, HealthMonitor
description:
attached_molecule: ev-wisp-d537
attached_at: 2026-02-17T23:53:20Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Phase 3 of RPC fallback chain (per en-25w5). Implement shared RPC infrastructure: (1) CircuitBreaker — state machine CLOSED/OPEN/HALF_OPEN per (chainId, provider), 5 failures/60s triggers OPEN, 30s timeout, 3 successes to close. (2) TokenBucketRateLimiter — per-endpoint rate limiting from rateLimitRps config. (3) RpcFallbackChain — ordered endpoint traversal with circuit breaker + rate limiter, cache fallback, 30s total timeout. (4) HealthMonitor — background ping per provider (60s interval, eth_blockNumber for EVM). (5) ProviderMetrics — P50/P95/P99 latency, rolling 5-min error rate. Retry: maxAttempts=2, exponential backoff, skip on 403. Use RpcProviderConfig types from latest @cygnus-wealth/data-models. Export all classes for sol-integration to import. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally.
dispatched_by: mayor

RPC fallback chain Phase 3 (per en-25w5 directive). Depends on Phase 1 (data-models types).

Implement shared RPC infrastructure classes. Per the directive, these could be a shared package or duplicated. Implement in evm-integration first (sol-integration can import or duplicate):

- CircuitBreaker: state machine (CLOSED→OPEN→HALF_OPEN→CLOSED) per (chainId, provider). 5 failures/60s → OPEN, 30s timeout, 3 successes to close.
- TokenBucketRateLimiter: per-endpoint rate limiting based on rateLimitRps config
- RpcFallbackChain: ordered endpoint list, circuit breaker + rate limiter integration, cache fallback, total timeout enforcement (30s default)
- HealthMonitor: background ping per provider per chain (60s interval), lightweight calls (eth_blockNumber for EVM)
- ProviderMetrics: latency tracking (P50/P95/P99), error rate (rolling 5-min window)

Retry within endpoint: maxAttempts=2, exponential backoff. Skip retry on 403/auth failures.
Follow TDD.
